Generate API Request "Offset" Sequence

Source: R/utils.R
offset_sequence.Rd

Generate API Request "Offset" Sequence

Usage

offset_sequence(nobs, limit)

Arguments

nobs

<int> Number of results returned in the API request

limit

<int> Maximum number of results an API will return per request

Value

<int> If nobs > limit, an integer sequence beginning at 0 of length equal to nobs / limit + 1. If nobs <= limit, the function simply returns nobs.

Examples

offset_sequence(100, 10)
#>  [1]   0  11  21  31  41  51  61  71  81  91 101 100

offset_sequence(10, 100)
#> [1] 10

offset_sequence(47984, 5000)
#>  [1]     0  5001 10001 15001 20001 25001 30001 35001 40001 45001 47984

offset_sequence(147984, 2000)
#>  [1]      0   2001   4001   6001   8001  10001  12001  14001  16001  18001
#> [11]  20001  22001  24001  26001  28001  30001  32001  34001  36001  38001
#> [21]  40001  42001  44001  46001  48001  50001  52001  54001  56001  58001
#> [31]  60001  62001  64001  66001  68001  70001  72001  74001  76001  78001
#> [41]  80001  82001  84001  86001  88001  90001  92001  94001  96001  98001
#> [51] 100001 102001 104001 106001 108001 110001 112001 114001 116001 118001
#> [61] 120001 122001 124001 126001 128001 130001 132001 134001 136001 138001
#> [71] 140001 142001 144001 146001 147984
